p.s: I have received your letter with the sonnet and I am how responding to you.
The message of the sonnet is very deep and I have never thought like this over this quesstion.
I like your sonnet and I think it shows the effects and the unstoppability of time very pictoral.
I can agree with you and I think that everything gets destroyed by the time someday.
But even if the imagination of that is not comfortable, I think that this is a thing of nature.
Everything that lives dies and nothing is really endless.
I also like the message of the last two lines that you still love writing, even if time could destroy your texts someday.
In my opinion, you are one of the most important and influentalinfluential writer in history, even 500 years later!
You hae invented over 1700 words and people still use those words.
People also use popular phrases from your plays and sonnets without even knowing.
To be or not to be; that is the question is a famous example for that.
Also your themes are still relevant today.
Love, death, time and beauty are themes with no matter of time which makes your plays or sonnets almost timeless.
These themes will not lose their matter because they are part of the life of a human.
Thank you very much for your letter,
